grounding: In this article we survey recent advances in the economic theory of cultural transmission. We highlight three main themes on which the literature has made great progress in the last 10 years: the domain of traits subject to cultural transmission; the microfoundations for the technology of transmission; and feedback effects between culture, institutions, and various socioeconomic environments. We conclude by suggesting interesting areas for future research.
generated_text: This study explores recent advancements in the economic theory of cultural transmission, emphasizing its role in the evolution of institutions. By integrating interdisciplinary approaches, the research highlights how cultural norms and values are passed across generations, influencing institutional development. The findings underscore the dynamic interplay between cultural evolution and economic structures, offering insights into how cultural factors shape economic outcomes and institutional resilience over time.
